ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.service

Class SurveyService

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.service.SurveyService

  • @Service
public class SurveyService
extends java.lang.Object
    This service class contains all the main functionalities of the Survey class
    Author:
    Ilana Haddad, Diana Serra

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SurveyService(VersionManager vm)
      The SurveyService constructor verifies which version has been selected by the user, finds the TreeManager associated to that version and sets the class's TreeManager as that one for users to edit attributes on that TreeManager.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SurveyService

        public SurveyService(VersionManager vm)
        The SurveyService constructor verifies which version has been selected by the user, finds the TreeManager associated to that version and sets the class's TreeManager as that one for users to edit attributes on that TreeManager.
        Parameters:
        vm - VersionManager of the application

    • Method Detail

      • checkIfEditable

        public void checkIfEditable(TreeManager tm)
                     throws InvalidInputException
        This method checks if the tree manager is editable to the user. Only the latest non-forecasted version is editable.
        Parameters:
        tm - current version that is selected
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - input exception handling

      • refreshSelectedTmAndCheckIfEditable

        public void refreshSelectedTmAndCheckIfEditable()
                                         throws InvalidInputException
        This method refreshes TreeLog to the selected version and checks if it is editable.
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException

      • createSurvey

        public Survey createSurvey(java.sql.Date reportDate,
                           Tree tree,
                           java.lang.String surveyor,
                           Tree.Status newTreeStatus)
                    throws InvalidInputException
        This method creates a new survey for a certain tree
        Parameters:
        reportDate - date of the survey (current date)
        tree - desired tree to be surveyed
        surveyor - name of the surveyor
        newTreeStatus - new status of the tree (planted, diseased, to be cut-down, cut-down)
        Returns:
        returns updated survey
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - returns error if inputs are null, empty or if status has not been changed

      • getSurveyStatusFromTreeStatus

        public Survey.Status getSurveyStatusFromTreeStatus(Tree.Status treeStatus)
        This method converts a Tree.Status enum to a Survey.Status enum in order to set a survey's status given a tree's status
        Parameters:
        treeStatus - tree's status to convert
        Returns:
        survey status with the same name

      • getTreeForSurvey

        public Tree getTreeForSurvey(Survey survey)
        This method looks for the tree the survey is associated to
        Parameters:
        survey - to find tree for
        Returns:
        tree associated to given survey

      • getTreeById

        public Tree getTreeById(int id)
        This method gets the tree given an ID
        Parameters:
        id - ID#
        Returns:
        returns desired tree based on ID#

      • editSurvey

        public void editSurvey(Survey survey,
                       java.sql.Date editDate,
                       java.lang.String editor,
                       Tree.Status editedTreeStatus)
                throws InvalidInputException
        This method allows the user to edit the date, surveyor and/or status of the tree
        Parameters:
        survey - desired survey to be edited
        editDate - new survey date
        editor - new surveyor
        editedTreeStatus - new status to edited
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - returns error if inputs or null or if survey does not exist in TreeLog

      • getAllSurveys

        public java.util.List<Survey> getAllSurveys()
        This method returns all the surveys in TreeLog
        Returns:
        returns all surveys in system

      • getSurveysForTree

        public java.util.List<Survey> getSurveysForTree(Tree t)
                                         throws InvalidInputException
        This method returns all the surveys for a certain tree
        Parameters:
        t - desired tree
        Returns:
        returns all the surveys for the desired tree
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - returns error if no surveys exist for this tree
